result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert Evans is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert Evans was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees, surcharges, and mandatory DNA surcharge. The $500.00 cash bail posted on 4-29-14 is to be applied to all monetary obligations.  Any remaining balance of unpaid financial obligations after application of cash bail to same must be paid with 120 DAYS of this hearing or a civil judgment shall be entered. Any amounts, if any, remaining after application to costs, fees, surcharges is to be returned to person posting bail.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Evans

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter in response to defendant's request to vacate the mandatory DNA surcharge of this case.
Defendant's pro se request to vacate DNA surcharge.
Of Right To Seek Postconviction Relief, FILED.
FILED.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit, FILED.
FILED.
TIME SERVED.

Defendant Robert Evans in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Robert Evans in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Amended Information which was initially filed with the Court during today's hearing was withdrawn by State Prosecutor for reasons stated on the record.  

COUNT 1:  DISMISSED UPON THE STATE PROSECUTOR'S MOTION.

AS TO COUNT 2, Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.   Court ordered defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction, with 20 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

-  Court ordered Defendant to pay all applicable costs/fees/surcharges.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
-  Defendant to pay MANDATORY DNA Surcharge;  failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
-  Victim Impact Statement,FILED.
-  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, FILED.
-  Pretrial Incarceration Credit,  FILED.
-
-  Cash Bail in the amount of $500.00, posted on 04-29-2014 is to be applied toall monetary obligations.  Any amounts, if any, remaining after application to costs/fees/surcharges is to be returned to person posting bail.  Any remaining balance of unpaid financial obligations after the application of cash bail to same must be paid with 120 DAYS of this hearing or a civil judgment shall be entered.
-  Civil Judgment Warnings given.

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-29-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert Evans in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant, Robert Evans, having appeared, Bench Warrant stayed until today's hearing is WITHDRAWN by the Court. Pretrial Conference scheduled for a later date in Branch 22.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-09-2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Valeria L Taylor in court.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant appeared in court at 08:30am and was informed by bailiff that his scheduling conference was scheduled for 01:30pm on today.   Defendant did not appear at 01:30pm scheduling conference as required.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until Status Conference set for a later date in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for 05-07-2014 at 08:30 am.
FILE STAYS IN COURT PENDING STATUS CONFERENCE.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing APRIL 24, 2014 received and filed. (17 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Valeria Taylor - SPD  819 N 6th Street  9th Floor  Milwaukee, WI  53203.

14RM022657  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04-25-14
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Robert Evans in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  Defendant Robert Evans in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Joshua Albert.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.

Defense made motion to reduce bail.  Arguments heard, Court denies.  Bail is not amended.

Defense requested that defendant be produced for all court dates.  Court does not make a decision, but directs defense to submit a motion with Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Celeste R. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Robert Evans in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Robert Evans in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert Evans
Current: 2902 N 44th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210 United States  (Effective: 04-11-2014)
Prior: 1490 Martin Street, Madison, WI 53713
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
